overview: Students enrol in Empirical Corporate Finance followed by the subject Empirical Investments as the subjects are completed in two consecutive semesters. A number of seminars will be held during the semester to discuss various aspects of the program including bibliographic and other resources available to students and a range of analytical and empirical research methods and techniques used in Finance. Among other things, the workshops provide a forum for students to discuss and develop their own research proposals, and to develop seminar and conference presentation ability.
generic_skills: Synthesis of data and other information
Evaluation of data and other information
Accessing data and other information from a range of sources

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Three group assignments (in groups of approximately 3)
assessment.timing: Due in weeks 4 and 8 and during the final examination period

assessment.brief: Four individual in-class presentations of seminar papers
